ã¾ãŸã€ã›ã£ã‹ãã®æ©Ÿä¼šã§ã™ã®ã§ã€ä¸€èˆ¬å‚åŠ è€…ã‹ã‚‰ã‚‚DHHã¨ã®å¯¾è«‡ã®å ´ã¸ã®å‚åŠ è€…ã‚’å‹Ÿã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚ã“ã®æ ã¯ã€Forkwellä¼šå“¡é™å®šã§ç”³ã—è¾¼ã‚€ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã¾ã™ã€‚é‹å–¶ã¯ã€å‚åŠ ç”³è¾¼è€…ã® Forkwell ãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆãƒ•ã‚©ãƒªã‚ªã‚’æ‹è¦‹ã—ã€èªå­¦åŠ›ã€RailsçµŒé¨“ç­‰ã‚’è€ƒæ…®ã—ã¦ã€1~2åç¨‹åº¦æŒ‡åã„ãŸã—ã¾ã™ã€‚æŒ‡åãŒã‚¼ãƒ­ã¨ãªã‚‹å¯èƒ½æ€§ãŒã‚ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã‚‚ã”äº†æ‰¿ãã ã•ã„ã€‚

Forkwell has a vision to shape the future with creators, together. We are now providing "The Global Dev Study" - An online event that allows developers to build software and applications with the latest technologies.

Forkwell will continue to host multiple study groups with the purpose of inviting speakers who are familiar with each field of information technology, from the perspective of those who are active on the front lines, to comprehensively learn the latest insight and updates about information technology.

We are excited to announce that David Heinemeier Hansson, co-founder, and CTO at Basecamp, will be joining us for a virtual fireside chat.

We would be glad if we could create a comprehensive study session where you can learn the latest information technologies required to enhance a software developerâ€™s career!

Suitable For

Those who want to
- comprehensively learn about the latest technology
- catch up on the latest technology trends
- learn important ideas in selected technologies for certain framework and practice
- see how much they understand technology
- interested in the careers of software engineers and researchers

The Global Dev Study #3 - Fireside Chat with DHH

Summary

Originally from Denmark, David Heinemeier Hansson is most known for his role as co-founder and CTO of the highly successful real-time communication and project management tool, Basecamp (formerly known as 37 Signals). Trusted by millions, Basecamp puts everything you need to get work done in one place, billing itself as the calm, organized way to manage projects, work with clients, and speak with your team. In addition, David is also the creator of the popular â€˜Ruby on Rails web development framework. If this wasnâ€™t enough, he is also the author of books like â€œAgile Web Development with Railsâ€, â€œGetting Realâ€, and best-selling business books â€œReworkâ€ and â€œRemoteâ€. Showing his competitive side, David is also Le Mans and WEC class-winning racing car driver.

The fireside chat will be for 60 minutes whereby you will get to learn from his insights and pick his brains, please register and attend Fireside Chat with DHH - The Global Dev Study #3

Speaker

ã€€David Heinemeier Hansson Creator, Rails. Co-founder & CTO, Basecamp
David Heinemeier Hansson is the creator of Ruby on Rails, co-founder of Basecamp & HEY, best-selling author, Le Mans class-winning racing driver, antitrust advocate and a frequent podcast guest.


Moderator

Bary ï¼ˆ@bary822ï¼‰
Lead Engineer - Grooves Inc. Forkwell
Bary(Hiroto Fukui) is a Lead Engineer at Grooves. Since he started playing with programming back when he's a high school student, he has worked on various development projects including Web App, Data Engineering, and DevOps. When not making noise with his keyboard, he enjoys SUP surfing with his best-friend dog.

Time Table

Time Agenda
02:00ã€œ Opening & Guest Intro (5min)
02:05ã€œ Fireside Chat/Q&A (50min)
ã€œ03:00 Forkwell Announcement (5min)

â€» This time table is only a guide. Changes are due to circumstances.

How to Join

This session will be held on YouTube (live). Please post any Questions on the content of this lecture on Slido. We also welcome any comments and thoughts on Twitter.
You can participate from the URL below.

â–Broadcast Venue
ã€€ãƒ»YouTube Live
ã€€ã€€ https://youtu.be/4AwLplk1Aj0

â–Event Guid
ã€€ãƒ»Slido Anonymous Q&A
ã€€ã€€ https://app.sli.do/event/zokffuao/live/questions

ã€€ãƒ»Twitter HashTag
ã€€ã€€ https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?hashtags=TheGlobalDevStudy

In order to value the live participation experience which will be provided by the linkage with Twitter TL, the chasing playback apparatus on YouTube Live will be disabled.
Please view the distributing program, or the archive which will be able to view after few hours.

Points to Note

  • There will be a session that promotes Forkwell
  • Since this is an event for software engineers, participation of non-engineers and IT industry recruiting activities within this event are not welcomed.
  • The scenery of the event and the social gathering may be published in an article (event report) on Forkwell media. If you do not wish to be posted, please let us know that you do not want to be posted from the event page inquiry form on the day.
  • We may ask you to leave the event even during the event if the management decides that your participation is not suitable for other participants enjoying the session to the fullest.
    -- Including:
    - Those who are seen as having the purpose of soliciting insurance, religion, or network business
    - Others who judge that participation is inappropriate by management

Organizer

We support engineering careers Forkwell
Job-search website for high level IT/Web engineers Forkwell Jobs
